snippet: When President Obama visits China on Monday, authorities there are likely to dwell more on his electoral reversals than on the robust American economy, analysts say.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; when President Obama travels to Beijing to meet with Pres Xi Jinping, some analysts believe China will focus on his electoral reversals rather than on the comparatively robust American recovery; analysts say Obama's best bet to counter doubts about his standing will be to move quickly on projects that reinforce American's presence in region, like proposed trade deal.
lead_paragraph: When President Obama visits China on Monday, authorities there are likely to dwell more on his electoral reversals than on the robust American economy, analysts say.

headline.main: To China, Shift in Obama’s Political Fortunes Eclipses U.S. Economic Gains
headline.print_headline: To China, Shift in Obama’s Political Fortunes Eclipses U.S. Economic Gains
